snippet: “Lady Day at Emerson’s Bar and Grill,” starring Audra McDonald, takes place in the months before Billie Holiday died, set in a city that she had reason to loathe.
abstract: Charles Isherwood reviews musical theater piece Lady Day at Emerson's Bar and Grill, written by Lanie Robertson and directed by Lonny Price, at Circle in the Square; show stars Audra McDonald as singer Billie Holiday.
